text: Anyone else found themselves always hitting "save and go to module list" by default when they are editing a repeating item in a module? Probably just a habit that needs to be broken. When I want to edit multiple repeating items you have to remember to hit apply and then hit the little back link at the top to go to the list of repeating items. Any better way to approach this from an editing/button standpoint? Almost wish the "Save and go" button would just take you back to the list of items rather than the list of ALL modules on the page.
All of this... plus give us some sort of "Re-process / update" button to see changes reflected that require HubL to get re-rendered
So the two buttons could be "Update and continue editing" and "save / return".......... Much like the blog post editor
Or remove the buttons. I see when editing the default content in Design Manager that the buttons aren't there, you just simply click the < Back to .... link at the top.

<@U2H1YLSE6> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U2H1YLSE6/F9UNML2GM/image.png|Anyone else think no_wrapper should be true by default on the new modules? I find my using it on everything.>
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.
